titles.title: He Keeps Me Singing (Luther B. Bridgers)

properties.verseOrder: v1 v2 v3 v4 v5 v6

verse.name: v1
verse.lines: {lang-eng}There’s within my heart a melody. Jesus whispers sweet and low; “Fear not, I am with thee; peace, be still,” In all of life’s ebb and flow.{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: {lang-eng}Jesus, Jesus, Jesus, sweetest name I know, Fills my ev’ry longing, keeps me singing as I go.{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: {lang-eng}All my life was wrecked by sin and strife; discord filled my life with pain. Jesus swept across the broken strings, stirred the slumb’ring chords again.{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: {lang-eng}Feasting on the riches of His grace, resting ‘neath His shelt’ring wing, Always looking on His smiling face, that is why I shout and sing.{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v5
verse.lines: {lang-eng}Tho’ sometimes He leads thro’ waters deep, trials fall across my way, Tho’ sometimes the path seems rough and steep, see His footprints all the way.{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v6
verse.lines: {lang-eng}Soon He’s coming back to welcome me far beyond the starry sky, I shall wing my flight to worlds unknown; I shall reign with Him on high.{/lang-eng}
